response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 2 cups sugar, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1 tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, combine 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla, and 1 cup boiling water. Whisk until smooth. Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined; the batter will be thin.",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Bake for 30–35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.",
  "step4": "While cakes cool, prepare frosting: beat ½ cup softened butter until creamy. Gradually add 3 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy, adding more milk if needed for desired consistency.",
  "step5": "Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread a generous layer of frosting over the top. Add the second layer, then apply a thin crumb coat around the entire cake. Chill for 15 minutes to set the crumb coat before applying the final thick frosting layer.",
  "step6": "Finish with decorative chocolate shavings or sprinkles. Slice, serve, and enjoy the moist, rich chocolate cake with a velvety frosting—perfect for 8 guests."
}
